channel.title: 华尔街日报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪华尔街日报news的种子

item.title: 17 年后，长滩州立大学和教练丹-蒙森（Dan Monson）同意分道扬镳。然后，他同意继续执教，并率领他的球队不出意外地进入了 NCAA 锦标赛。
item.description:
After 17 years, Long Beach State and coach Dan Monson agreed to part ways. Then he agreed to finish out the campaign—and led his team to an improbable NCAA tournament bid. https://t.co/fGLfMBi9Ko https://t.co/fGLfMBi9Ko

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 街谈巷议日本负利率的终结将是一场缓慢移动的海啸，其长期影响可能是深远的
item.description:

item.title: 继上周末巴基斯坦境内发生多起袭击事件后，巴基斯坦对邻国阿富汗进行了空袭，当局将这些袭击事件归咎于边境另一侧的武装分子。
item.description:

item.title: 联邦快递和亚马逊曾探讨过开展更多业务，去年还讨论过联邦快递在其零售点接受亚马逊包裹退货的问题，但并未达成协议。
item.description:
FedEx and https://t.co/KUZV6DVpXq have explored doing more business with each other, last year discussing FedEx accepting Amazon package returns at its retail locations—but didn’t reach a deal https://t.co/DjJGz51mud https://t.co/DjJGz51mud

item.title: 本周晚些时候，Reddit 将在股票市场首次亮相，Reddit 用户将有机会在这个社交媒体平台上分一杯羹。
item.description:

item.title: 语言学家 Anne Curzan 写道："Irregardless"（不管不顾）触动了人们内心深处对语言的一些感受，但它实际上是一个词
item.description:

item.title: 谷歌 Podcasts 应用程序将于 4 月 2 日后停止让听众收听播客。以下是安卓用户继续收听《华尔街日报》播客的其他方法
item.description:

item.title: 由于食品价格不断上涨，在苹果蜂餐厅（Applebee's）晚餐约会是美国餐饮业最热门的门票之一。但是，一张价值 1500 美元的餐厅每周用餐的稀有通行证，却让厌倦了通货膨胀的食客们一见倾心。
item.description:
A dinner date at Applebee's is one of the hottest tickets in American dining, thanks to escalating food prices. But a rare pass for $1,500 worth of weekly meals at the restaurant became an instant hit for inflation-weary diners. https://t.co/2ZsnAoE2F9 https://t.co/2ZsnAoE2F9

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 杜卡迪北美公司的Jason Chinnock驾驶2021年款吉普牧马人Rubicon 392，以两轮换四轮的方式进行越野探险。

item.title: 自纽约市打击短租以来，纽约市的旅游环境发生了根本性的变化。纽约市 Airbnbs 上列出的短期租房数量从 8 月份的约 21500 套下降到 2 月份的约 3280 套。
item.description:
The travel landscape in New York City has changed fundamentally since its crackdown on short-term rentals. The number of short-term units listed on NYC Airbnbs dropped from about 21,500 in August to about 3,280 in February. https://t.co/Bgv2TOQ1hz https://t.co/Bgv2TOQ1hz

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 北卡罗来纳州一座占地 40 英亩的山顶庄园将以 4999 万美元的价格上市，远远超过卡罗来纳州房屋的最高售价
item.description:
A mountaintop estate on 40 acres in North Carolina is going on the market for $49.99 million, far more than the highest price ever paid for a home in the Carolinas https://t.co/TZTgZMPOEm https://t.co/TZTgZMPOEm

item.title: 在数百人上街抗议停电和食品匮乏之际，古巴国营电信公司削减了岛上部分地区的移动互联网服务
item.description:
Cuba’s state-run telecommunications company curtailed mobile internet service in parts of the island as hundreds took to the streets to protest power outages and lack of food https://t.co/UQb4QAAaDl https://t.co/UQb4QAAaDl

item.title: 如果 TikTok 被禁，它可能会起诉政府，迫使法官权衡国家安全目标与视频应用巨头及其用户的第一修正案权利。
item.description:
If TikTok is banned, it could sue the government, forcing judges to weigh national security objectives against the First Amendment rights of the video app juggernaut and its users https://t.co/P5IFcCCrMK https://t.co/P5IFcCCrMK

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 为了摆脱多年来因大流行病而造成的与世隔绝的局面，中国正在释放魅力，吸引外国人回国。这比过去更难推销。
item.description:
China is turning on the charm to lure back foreigners, part of an effort to shed years of pandemic-induced isolation that’s sapping its economy. It’s a tougher sell than it used to be. https://t.co/H1xCCCVyRd https://t.co/H1xCCCVyRd

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 远离东京和京都的旅游人群，日本的一条多日徒步旅行线路让游客沉浸在 2011 年遭受毁灭性海啸袭击的社区的文化和美食之中
item.description:
Far from the tourist crowds of Tokyo and Kyoto, a Japanese multi-day hiking trail immerses travelers in the culture and cuisine of a community hit by a devastating tsunami in 2011 https://t.co/BPWQCIBgGt https://t.co/BPWQCIBgGt

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 惹怒 NFL。聘请一位 "F "爆主持人把赌注押在流媒体上ESPN 的吉米-皮塔洛（Jimmy Pitaro）正在走出自己的舒适区，以确保这家体育巨头的未来。
item.description:
Ticking off the NFL. Hiring an F-bomb throwing host. Betting the house on streaming. ESPN's Jimmy Pitaro is stretching outside his comfort zone to secure the sports giant's future. https://t.co/NZuQ91CdZo https://t.co/NZuQ91CdZo

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 精英圈子里的职场妈妈们对魔幻蘑菇赞不绝口："在我接触的每 10 位女性中，就有 8 位在服用微型毒品"。
item.description:
Working moms in elite enclaves are singing the praises of magic mushrooms: “Out of every 10 women I talk to, eight are microdosing.” https://t.co/tvaOhPmvaf https://t.co/tvaOhPmvaf

item.title: 航空公司首席执行官迈克尔-奥利里（Michael O'Leary）今年有望获得 1 亿多美元的奖金。F 炸弹、出言不逊的笑话和醉醺醺的晚餐都是他的口头禅。
item.description:
The airline CEO Michael O’Leary is on course for a $100 million-plus bonus this year. F-bombs, off-color jokes and drunken dinners are all part of his lore. https://t.co/IYubO4Slu8 https://t.co/IYubO4Slu8

— The Wall Street Journal (@WSJ) March 18, 2024

item.title: 著名现代主义建筑师约瑟夫-埃舍利克（Joseph Esherick）在加利福尼亚州设计的一栋房屋自近 70 年前建成以来首次进入市场。

item.title: 优步（Uber）已同意支付 1.78 亿美元，以了结澳大利亚的一起集体诉讼。
item.description:
